FullVaccinename: Adenovirus, type 4 and type 7, live, oral

diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, 5 pertussis antigens
diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, unspecified formulation
Notes: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a DTaP vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

Diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, and poliovirus vaccine, inactivated
Historical diphtheria and tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis, poliovirus, Haemophilus b conjugate and hepatitis B (recombinant) vaccine.

FullVaccinename: non-US diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate, and poliovirus vaccine, inactivated (DTaP-Hib-IPV)

FullVaccinename: diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and pertussis vaccine
Diphtheria, pertussis, tetanus, hepatitis B, Haemophilus Influenza Type b, (Pentavalent)

DTP- Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate and hepatitis b vaccine
Notes: This CVX has been corrected. This non-US vaccine contained DTP, Hib and Hep B. It was withdrawn in 2007 .

ShortDescription: Ebola Zaire vaccine, live, recombinant, 1mL dose
FullVaccinename: Ebola Zaire vaccine, live, recombinant, 1mL dose
Notes: FDA Approval Pending
This vaccine is not available in the US.

FullVaccinename: hepatitis A vaccine, pediatric/adolescent dosage, 2 dose schedule
hepatitis A vaccine, pediatric/adolescent dosage, 3 dose schedule
Notes: This vaccine formulation is inactive and should not be used, except to record historic vaccinations with this formulation.

FullVaccinename: hepatitis A vaccine, pediatric dosage, unspecified formulation
Notes: Do NOT use this code.  If formulation is unknown, use CVX 85.  There is only one formulation of Hep A, peds.
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a HepA vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

FullVaccinename: hepatitis A and hepatitis B vaccine
hepatitis A and hepatitis B vaccine, pediatric/adolescent (non-US)
Notes: e.g. Twinrix Junior available in Canada

FullVaccinename: hepatitis B vaccine, pediatric or pediatric/adolescent dosage
Notes: This code applies to any standard pediatric formulation of Hepatitis B vaccine. It should not be used for the 2-dose hepatitis B schedule for adolescents (11-15 year olds). It requires Merck's Recombivax HB adult formulation. Use code 43 for that vaccine.

FullVaccinename: hepatitis B vaccine, adolescent/high risk infant dosage
Notes: As of August 27, 1998, Merck ceased distribution of their adolescent/high risk infant hepatitis B vaccine dosage. Code 42 should only be used to record historical records. For current administration of hepatitis B vaccine, pediatric/adolescent dosage, use code 08.

As of September 1999, a 2-dose hepatitis B schedule for adolescents (11-15 year olds) was FDA approved for Merck's Recombivax HB adult formulation. Use code 43 for the 2-dose. This code should be used for any use of standard adult formulation of hepatitis B vaccine.

FullVaccinename: hepatitis B vaccine, dialysis patient dosage
Notes: NDCs that are used for both vaccine and dialysis (e.g. Engerix-B)  are mapped to CVX 43 which is not specific to dialysis use
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a HepB vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

Haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine, PRP-D conjugate
Haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine, PRP-OMP conjugate

Haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine, conjugate unspecified formulation
Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate and Hepatitis B vaccine
Notes: This vaccine may still be in use until the existing lots expire on 8/19/16.
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a HPV vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

Notes: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a Influenza vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

FullVaccinename: Japanese Encephalitis vaccine for intramuscular administration

Notes: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a JE vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

This CVX is intended for use when one of the meningococcal vaccines containing serogroups A, C, W and Y (conjugate or polysaccaride) was given and the exact formulation was not recorded. It should not be used to record newly administered immunizations. It is not to be used when one of the meningococcal vaccines containing other serogroups was administered.

FullVaccinename: meningococcal B vaccine, recombinant, OMV, adjuvanted
Meningococcal Groups C and Y and Haemophilus b Tetanus Toxoid Conjugate Vaccine
Meningococcal, MCV4, unspecified conjugate formulation(groups A, C, Y and W-135)
Notes: This CVX should only be used for historical doses of meningococcal conjugate vaccine where the formulation is unknown (oligosaccharide vs polysaccharide). It is not the same as CVX 108, Meningococcal, unspecified formulation. This CVX is for unspecified Meningococcal conjugate vaccines.

FullVaccinename: meningococcal oligosaccharide (groups A, C, Y and W-135) diphtheria toxoid conjugate vaccine (MCV4O)
meningococcal polysaccharide (groups A, C, Y and W-135) diphtheria toxoid conjugate vaccine (MCV4P)

FullVaccinename: meningococcal polysaccharide (groups A, C, Y, W-135) tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine .5mL dose, preservative free
meningococcal vaccine of unknown formulation and unknown serogroups
Notes: This CVX is intended for use when any one of the meningococcal vaccines is recorded and there is no information about which serogroups are protected against. This code should not be used when a newly administered immunization is recorded.

FullVaccinename: measles, mumps and rubella virus vaccine
measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella virus vaccine

Notes: This code is used whenever the actual formulation is not determined or when aggregating all Novel H1N1 Influenza-09 immunizations for reporting to CRA. It should not be used for seasonal influenza vaccine that is not otherwise specified. (NOS)

Notes: This is the OPV that was used in the US

Notes: This is a non-US vaccine that may be seen in some immunization histories.
This code represents an oral polio vaccine where the specific formulation is unknown.
This is a foreign vaccine

This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a polio vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

rabies vaccine, for intramuscular injection RETIRED CODE

Unspecified code for COVID-19 not to be used to record patient US administration. May be used to record historic US administration if product not known.  CVX code 500 should be used to record Non-US vaccine where product is not known.

Notes: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a VEE vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)
This is the YF vaccine that has been available in the US for years. It is stabilized with sorbitol and gelatin.
This vaccine is stabilized with sorbitol and lactose and has been used outside the US for some time. It will be made available in the US.
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a zoster vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)
This is the adjuvant that is packaged with H5N1 vaccine, adjuvanted
Do not use this code. This product may be used for Hep A and other viral infections. The correct vaccine / CVX is 86 (IG).

Code 998 was added for use in VXU HL7 messages where the OBX segment is nested with the RXA segment, but the message does not contain information about a vaccine administration. An example of this use is to report the vaccines due next for a patient when no vaccine administration is being reported.
Code 99 will not be used in this table to avoid confusion with code 999.
This immune globulin may be administered IM only.

Notes: This immune globulin may be administered either IM or IV.
